SEARCH
Package myTest

Class ListAdapterTest

java.lang.Object
myTest.ListAdapterTest
public class ListAdapterTest extends Object

Summary
This class represents a detailed description of the test case. It is designed to thoroughly test the functionality of the ListAdapter class and methods. The test cases in this class are organized into logical groups for better understanding and maintenance.

Test Case Design
The design of the test cases in this class involves setting up necessary preconditions, executing the method or class under test, and then verifying the post conditions. The test cases are designed to cover both positive and negative scenarios, and edge cases if any. The setup information and topologies used for testing are also documented for each test case.

  • Method Details

    • listAdapter_ShouldBeCreated_FromAnotherList

      public void listAdapter_ShouldBeCreated_FromAnotherList()
      Verifies that a new ListAdapter can be created from another ListAdapter.
      Test Case Design:
      The test creates a new empty ListAdapter and then creates another ListAdapter by passing the first one as a parameter to the constructor.
      Test Description:
      The test verifies that the new ListAdapter has been correctly created and that it is empty, like the original ListAdapter.
      Pre-Condition:
      The original ListAdapter is empty.
      Post-Condition:
      The new ListAdapter has been created and is empty.
      Expected Results:
      The test expects the new ListAdapter to be non-null and its size to be 0.

    • listAdapter_ShouldBeCreated_FromAnotherListWithRange

      public void listAdapter_ShouldBeCreated_FromAnotherListWithRange()
      Verifies that a new ListAdapter can be created from another ListAdapter with a range of elements.
      Test Case Design:
      The test creates a new ListAdapter with three elements and then creates another ListAdapter by passing the first one as a parameter to the constructor.
      Test Description:
      The test verifies that the new ListAdapter has been correctly created and that it contains the elements from the original ListAdapter.
      Pre-Condition:
      The original ListAdapter has three elements.
      Post-Condition:
      The new ListAdapter has been created and contains the elements from the original ListAdapter.
      Expected Results:
      The test expects the new ListAdapter to be non-null and its size to be 3.

    • addAll_ShouldAdd_fromAnotherCollection

      public void addAll_ShouldAdd_fromAnotherCollection()
      Verifies that the addAll method can add elements from another collection to the ListAdapter.
      Test Case Design:
      The test creates two new ListAdapters. The first one is empty and the second one contains two elements. The test then adds the elements from the second ListAdapter to the first one using the addAll method.
      Test Description:
      The test verifies that the first ListAdapter contains the elements from the second ListAdapter after the addAll operation.
      Pre-Condition:
      The first ListAdapter is empty and the second ListAdapter contains two elements.
      Post-Condition:
      The first ListAdapter contains the elements from the second ListAdapter.
      Expected Results:
      The test expects the first ListAdapter to be non-empty and its size to be 2 after the addAll operation.

      Test Description:
      The test verifies that the first ListAdapter contains the elements from the second ListAdapter at the correct index after the addAll operation.
      Pre-Condition:
      The first ListAdapter contains two elements and the second ListAdapter contains two different elements.
      Post-Condition:
      The first ListAdapter contains the elements from the second ListAdapter at the correct index.
      Expected Results:
      The test expects the first ListAdapter to contain the elements from the second ListAdapter at the correct index and its size to be 4 after the addAll operation.

      public void containsAll_ShouldReturn_True()

      Pre-Condition:

      The containsAll method of the ListAdapter has been verified for correct functionality.
      Expected Results:

      Post-Condition:

      Post-Condition:

      Expected Results:

      The test creates a new ListAdapter and adds some elements to it. It then calls the subList method with valid fromIndex and toIndex arguments.
      Test Description:
      The test verifies that the subList method returns a ListAdapter that contains the elements in the specified range from the original ListAdapter.
      Pre-Condition:
      The ListAdapter has been initialized and populated with elements.
      Post-Condition:
      The subList method of the ListAdapter has been verified for correct functionality.
      Expected Results:
      The test expects the subList method to return a ListAdapter that contains the elements in the specified range from the original ListAdapter.

      The ListAdapter has been initialized and populated with elements, and a sublist has been created from it.
      Post-Condition:

      Expected Results:
      The test expects the original ListAdapter to be empty after the clear operation on the sublist.

    • ListIterator_ShouldThrow_IllegalStateException_Remove

      public void ListIterator_ShouldThrow_IllegalStateException_Remove()
      Verifies that the listIterator's remove method throws an IllegalStateException when it is called before the next or previous method.
      Test Case Design:
      The test creates a new ListAdapter and adds an element to it. It then creates a listIterator and directly calls the remove method without calling next or previous.
      Test Description:
      The test verifies that an IllegalStateException is thrown when the remove method is called on a listIterator without a prior call to next or previous.
      Pre-Condition:
      The ListAdapter has been initialized and populated with elements.
      Post-Condition:
      An IllegalStateException is thrown.
      Expected Results:
      The test expects an IllegalStateException to be thrown.
